title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 20): Worker Cooperatives as Transitional Formations - Building Power With in the Workplace
summary: Start worker cooperatives as enterprises collectively owned and democratically managed by workers. Build transitional formations that redistribute power while prefiguring post-capitalist alternatives.

Money.summary: Create enterprises that distribute ownership and profits among workers rather than external investors.

level0: Gather core group of 3-15 committed people with shared vision
Choose enterprise type rooted in group's knowledge and community needs
level1: Create legal structure as worker cooperative
Develop business plan using consensus-based processes
level2: Launch cooperative with shared ownership and democratic management
level3: Build sustainable cooperative that models alternative to capitalist enterprise
Support others in starting or converting to worker co-ops

Power.summary: Redistribute workplace power from owners/managers to workers through democratic governance.

resources.label: A Yard and a Half Landscaping

level0: Use consensus or consent-based processes for all key decisions
Rotate facilitation and ensure all voices are heard
level1: Create governance structure that prevents hierarchy and concentration of power
Establish transparent decision-making and accountability systems
level2: Practice workplace democracy in daily operations and long-term planning
Address conflicts through restorative rather than punitive approaches
level3: Model democratic workplace relations for broader economic transformation

Community.summary: Connect worker cooperatives to broader community needs and solidarity economy networks.

level0: Root enterprise in community relationships and shared values
level1: Connect with local solidarity economy and cooperative networks
Partner with other cooperatives and community organizations
level2: Use cooperative to support broader community resilience and justice
Share resources and knowledge with other cooperative enterprises
level3: Build networks of connected cooperatives that support regional economic democracy
Create infrastructure for post-capitalist economic relationships

Narrative.summary: Challenge narratives about inevitable hierarchy in workplaces and demonstrate democratic alternatives.

level0: Practice seeing workers as capable of self-management and democratic decision-making
level1: Share stories about successful worker cooperatives and workplace democracy
Challenge myths about need for bosses and external ownership
level2: Help others understand cooperatives as alternative to capitalist enterprise
Model dignity and empowerment in work relationships
level3: Transform community understanding of work from exploitation to cooperation
Build culture where worker ownership and democracy are normalized
